intro: Tetracera gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's tetracera, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia, including Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically yellow or green. It grows as an erect shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species in botanical research.
